intro: Nonea aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its spiny stems and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by spherical, greenish fruits that turn red when mature. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with minimal water, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. Nonea aegyptiaca is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
